description:
11.216 scale_cuda
Scale (resize) and convert (pixel format) the input video, using accelerated CUDA kernels.
Setting the output width and height works in the same way as for the scale filter.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: scale_cuda

options.description:
Set the output video dimension expression. Default value is the input dimension.

Allows for the same expressions as the scale filter.
options.name: w

options.description:
Set the output video dimension expression. Default value is the input dimension.

Allows for the same expressions as the scale filter.
options.name: h

options.description:
Sets the algorithm used for scaling:

nearest

Nearest neighbour

Used by default if input parameters match the desired output.

bilinear

Bilinear

bicubic

Bicubic

This is the default.

lanczos

Lanczos
options.name: interp_algo

options.description:
Controls the output pixel format. By default, or if none is specified, the input pixel format is used.

The filter does not support converting between YUV and RGB pixel formats.
options.name: format

options.description:
If set to 0, every frame is processed, even if no conversion is necessary. This mode can be useful to use the filter as a buffer for a downstream frame-consumer that exhausts the limited decoder frame pool.

If set to 1, frames are passed through as-is if they match the desired output parameters. This is the default behaviour.
options.name: passthrough

options.description:
Algorithm-Specific parameter.

Affects the curves of the bicubic algorithm.
options.name: param

options.description: Work the same as the identical scale filter options.
options.name: force_original_aspect_ratio

options.description: Work the same as the identical scale filter options.
options.name: force_divisible_by
